thread.title: US Pacific Commander to visit NZ
thread.title_full: US Pacific Commander to visit NZ

title: US Pacific Commander to visit NZ
text:
US Pacific Commander to visit NZ 
Monday 6 Jul 2015 11:57 a.m. 
Admiral Harry Harris, Commander of the US Pacific Command (Reuters) 
By 3 News online staff 
Top brass of the US military will arrive in New Zealand today for talks with the Government and senior Defence officials. 
Admiral Harry B. Harris, Commander of the US Pacific Command, will arrive in Wellington on a US military aircraft today and will leave the country on Thursday. 
He will meet with Prime Minister John Key, Defence Minister Gerry Brownlee and Foreign Affairs Minister Murray McCully this afternoon. 
Admiral Harris will also hold talks with Lieutenant General Keating and Secretary of Defence Helene Quilter tomorrow, following a formal ceremonial welcome and wreath-laying ceremony at Pukeahu National War Memorial Park. 
He will also visit Linton Military Camp. 
Mr Brownlee met Admiral Harris at the annual Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore late last year. 
Admiral Harris isn't a stranger to New Zealand, having trained on a New Zealand Navy patrol vessel early in his career. 
Mr Brownlee says the defence relationship between the two countries "is a hugely important one, and it is in excellent shape". 
3 News
